title: MPs to question WRU bosses over game's future
description: The WRU chief executive and chair Welsh have been called to face the Welsh Affairs Committee over controversial changes to the professional game.

title: McFaul 'not in a position to commit' - Meenagh
description: Derry manager Ciaran Meenagh confirms that Ciaran McFaul 'is not in a position to commit' to the Oak Leaf panel for 2026.

title: Bethell scores stunning century but England edge towards defeat
description: Jacob Bethell's stunning maiden first-class century gave England an Ashes silver lining but could not prevent the tourists from sliding towards defeat in the fifth Test against Australia.

title: 'Magnificent innings' - Bethell makes first Test century
description: Watch the best of Jacob Bethell as he makes his maiden first-class century on day four of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: Commentator Hartley struggles to understand 'stupid' Jacks dismissal
description: Will Jacks' "stupidity" leads to a two-ball duck and frustration in the Test Match Special commentary box as the batter holes out to leave England on 219-5 on day four of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: 'Absolutely brilliant!' - Bethell brings up maiden Test century in style
description: Jacob Bethell smashes Beau Webster for four over deep mid-wicket to reach his first ever Test century, leaving England on 210-3 with a lead of 27 on day four of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: Crawley trapped lbw in first over playing no shot
description: Mitchell Starc strikes in the first over yet again as Zak Crawley is trapped lbw for one, having made no attempt at playing a shot, to leave England 4-1 on day four of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: Bethell learnt from NZ mistake to reach century
description: Jacob Bethell describes the "goosebump" moment of securing his first Test century, but says he used the disappointment of falling short of reaching the milestone in the Test series with New Zealand to ensure he stayed focused to get over the line on day four of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: Masters snooker all you need to know and match schedule
description: Match schedule, top seeds, prize money, former winners and BBC coverage details as the 2026 Masters gets under way at Alexandra Palace in London.

title: Inside Raiders' lost 2025 season: Tom Brady's influence, private meetings and dysfunction
description: "Who would want the Raiders job?" The inside story of how the Raiders went from playoff hopes to the No. 1 pick and another fired coach.

title: Late Gibbs-White penalty sinks helpless Hammers
description: A late Morgan Gibbs-White penalty gave Nottingham Forest a crucial away victory over West Ham, leaving the London side seven points adrift of safety.

title: 'It's happened!' - Smith is finally dismissed for 138
description: Josh Tongue takes the wicket of Steve Smith, as the Australian batter is caught behind for 138 to leave his side on 544-8 with a lead of 160 runs on day four of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: 'His day may be over' - Stokes leaves the field with groin injury
description: Ben Stokes is forced off the field with a groin injury in the middle of his 28th over, on day four of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: From Aronimink to Zalatoris - an A-Z of golf in 2026
description: It could be a struggle to match the tumultuous highs of last year but there is still plenty to look forward to in the coming 12 months, writes Iain Carter.

title: In Pictures: Sporting photos of the week
description: A selection of some of the most striking sports photographs taken around the world over the past seven days.

title: 'A moving moment' as Rosenior breaks barriers
description: Liam Rosenior's appointment as Chelsea manager is a "massive moment" for representation in the Premier League.

title: Amorim 'blow-up' brings Wilcox into the spotlight
description: Who is Manchester United's director of football Jason Wilcox and how did he become one of the most powerful figures in football?

title: Tactics, transfers and turmoil - inside the fall of Amorim
description: After 14 months, Ruben Amorim has been sacked by Manchester United - but where did it all go wrong?

title: Head? Stokes? Starc? Pick your team of the Ashes
description: Australia have retained the Ashes, but who makes your combined team of the series?

title: The acclaimed muscial adaptation of a Roald Dahl classic
description: Matilda has a sharp mind, vivid imagination and the worst parents in the world.

title: Booze, beach, beaten - how England lost the Ashes
description: BBC Sport chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt reveals the inside story of England's Ashes defeat in Australia on and off the pitch.

title: I've realised I can make a difference - Hoy
description: In a new BBC documentary, Sir Chris Hoy shows how he is using his Olympic mindset to reframe his purpose following a terminal cancer diagnosis.

title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
description: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
description: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
description: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.

title: 'Raise hell' - the fastest bowler you might not have heard of
description: The story of Duncan Spencer, the "frighteningly fast" bowler who could have played for England or Australia.

title: A race against the clock to make it home for Thanksgiving
description: The classic road trip comedy starring Steve Martin and John Candy
